info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:30AM CDT until April 05 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN STONE...NORTHEASTERN VAN BUREN AND NORTHWESTERN CLEBURNE COUNTIES... At 229 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Clinton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Heber Springs... Mountain View... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Greers Ferry... Shirley... Higden... Fairfield Bay Marina... Sugar Loaf Recreation Area... Old Lexington... Choctaw... Parma... Hanover... Rushing... Turkey Creek... Brownsville... Narrows Marina... Crabtree... Brewer... Choctow Recreation Area... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM CDT for north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
